thread.title: The Bachelor: Sandra says ‘‘I wasn’t drunk at the cocktail party’ | dailytelegraph.com.au
thread.title_full: The Bachelor: Sandra says ‘‘I wasn’t drunk at the cocktail party’ | dailytelegraph.com.au

author: Alison Stephenson
title: The Bachelor: Sandra says ‘‘I wasn’t drunk at the cocktail party’ | dailytelegraph.com.au
text:
IT seems we’ve already found this year’s Amber with primary school teacher Sandra emerging as the latest larger-than-life bachelorette to steal the spotlight on The Bachelor.
The 27-year-old from Victoria is already the talk of social media after her exuberant and over-the-top debut on the first episode of the dating show.
But there’s one thing Sandra wants Australia to know - she wasn’t drunk at the cocktail party - despite suspicion from fans that her charisma and confrontation with a fellow bachelorette might have been down to a few too many white wines.
Sandra must be wasted on champas #TheBachelorAU
— Bec Grove (@becgrove) July 29, 2015 “I didn’t have anything to drink that night,” Sandra told news.com.au, “I’m not big on alcohol, I’m really into fitness and a couple of the girls said to me ‘Sandra we thought you stole a bottle of champagne and downed it!’ and Heather was like ‘I thought you were drunk already’. And I was like ‘no, this is just me’. They were so shocked by how loud and confident and out of control I was, I don’t think they were expecting it. They always say a few champagnes give you confidence but I was like ‘I have enough confidence as it is!’” OK, calm down Sandra. Source: Channel 10
Sandra, 27, a primary school teacher from Victoria. Source: Channel 10
Sandra got a large proportion of the airtime on the debut episode, largely due to her confrontation with fellow Bachelorette Reshael.
So if first impressions are everything, why did she decide to confront one of the girls so early in the game?
“Emotions are running high, the public only sees an hour of the whole filming, but we were there for so long. The most important thing for me is that I’ve got a really positive
personality and if I need to defend myself, I will. I want to air things and get them out, I hate bottling things up and I wanted to address it with Reshael, tell her how I felt, clear the air and move on.
“I don’t regret anything I said or did although it did escalate more than it needed to when other people who weren’t there got involved. Hopefully Australia will like the funny side of me and not the out of control trying to attack people side of me.”
Sandra says she is mindful of the scrutiny her big personality might attract, but isn’t worried about how the public will perceive her because she knows she was her authentic self on the show.
Sandra needs her dosage adjusted #TheBachelorAu
— MandyKerr (@MandyKerr) July 29, 2015 OMG SHUT UP SANDRA! HOW ARE YOU A TEACHER. YOURE GOING TO GET PUNCHED! #TheBachelorAU
— Jess (@jess_kate26) July 29, 2015 Sandra and Reshael had a little confrontation on night one of The Bachelor Australia. Source: Channel 10
“The advice I’ve been given is to not worry about it,” she says of the “feedback” she might receive on social media. “I’m the type of person who does take things to heart, but people at home don’t know me, they only know five minutes of me on TV and I only care about what my friends and family say about me.”
She adds that she is aware she may come off as an “attention seeker” but can’t help if her positivity is misconstrued.
“If you’re looking from the outside, you could probably see it that way, but if you get to know me, you’ll see that I’m so excited about everything in life, I see the good in everyone and everything. I give 200 per cent to everything in life, I’m just a big kid really and the people that know me will agree that I’m like this 100 per cent of the time.” The contestants of the new season of The Bachelor, seated with Sam. . Source: Supplied
One can’t help but think that being 200 per cent of yourself all the time must be exhausting.
“I do get tired, I’m human and that’s obvious, but when I have Sandra time, I don’t sit in a corner being quiet, I’m at the gym or I’m dancing, I’m never sitting around, I’m still burning energy.”
So why then, with all that energy is this bubbly, bold and beautiful brunette still single?
“Most men are intimidated by my big personality, they lack the maturity to handle Sandra.”
Best of luck with that Sam. Why The Bachelor took the plunge 6:19 Play video
Sam Wood on why he was brave enough to sign up for The Bachelor after last year's drama
News Corp Australia 29 Jul 2015 Entertainment Originally published as Sandra: ‘I wasn’t drunk on The Bachelor’
